0.name: Chocolate Monkey
0.instructions: blend liqeuors with ice-cream, milk and syrup. pour into parfait glass, top with whipped cream and garnish with banana and cherry.

1.name: Grasshopper
1.instructions: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake briskly and then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

2.name: Royal Bitch
2.instructions: Into a shot glass layer the Crown Royal on top of the Frangelico.

3.name: Amaretto Mist
3.instructions: Pour amaretto in an old-fashioned glass over crushed ice. Add the wedge of lime and serve. (A wedge of lemon may be substituted for lime, if preferred.)

4.name: Horse's Neck
4.instructions: Pour brandy and ginger ale directly into highball glass with ice cubes. Stir gently. Garnish with lemon zest. If desired, add dashes of Angostura Bitter.

5.name: Lemouroudji
5.instructions: Juice the lemons. Peel and grate the ginger. Place the grated ginger and a liberal dash of the cayenne pepper into a piece of cheesecloth, and tie it into a knot. Let soak in the water. After 15 minutes or so, add the sugar, and the lemon juice. Chill, and serve.

6.name: Amaretto Sour
6.instructions: Shake and strain. Garnish with a cherry and an orange slice.

7.name: Atlantic Sun
7.instructions: Shake all the ingredients, top the drink with soda. Garnish with a slice of orange.

8.name: Shanghai Cocktail
8.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

9.name: Mississippi Planters Punch
9.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

10.name: Bleeding Surgeon
10.instructions: Pour Shot of Rum over slice of orange. Fill the remaining space in glass half way full of surge or similar drink. Finish off glass with cranberry juice. Be carefull, warm surge may foam over the glass.

11.name: Banana Strawberry Shake Daiquiri-type
11.instructions: Blend all together in a blender until smooth.

12.name: Brigadier
12.instructions: Mix ingredients in a warmed mug and stir.

13.name: Bramble
13.instructions: Fill glass with crushed ice. Build gin, lemon juice and simple syrup over. Stir, and then pour blackberry liqueur over in a circular fashion to create marbling effect. Garnish with two blackberries and lemon slice.

14.name: Herbal flame
14.instructions: Pour Hot Damn 100 in bottom of a jar or regular glass. Fill the rest of the glass with sweet tea. Stir with spoon, straw, or better yet a cinnamon stick and leave it in.

15.name: Negroni
15.instructions: Stir into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

16.name: Bruce's Puce
16.instructions: In a regular-sized shot glass, layer, with a spoon or cherry, the grenadine , the Kahlua , then the Bailey's Irish cream in equal portions. It goes down really smooth ,and you don't even need a chaser. It tastes just like chocolate milk.(Really!)

18.name: Grand Blue
18.instructions: Serve in an old fashioned glass.

19.name: Queen Charlotte
19.instructions: Pour red wine and grenadine into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with lemon-lime soda, stir, and serve.

20.name: Orange Oasis
20.instructions: Shake brandy, gin, and orange juice with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.

21.name: Cream Soda
21.instructions: Pour 1oz of Spiced Rum into a highball glass with ice. Fill with Ginger Ale.

22.name: Big Red
22.instructions: Pour ingredients into 1 ounce shot glass

23.name: Golden dream
23.instructions: Shake with cracked ice. Strain into glass and serve.

24.name: Gin Sour
24.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.

25.name: Brandon and Will's Coke Float
25.instructions: Scoop two large scoops of vanilla ice-cream into frosted beer mug. Next, add 2 ounces Maker's Mark. Then, pour in coke. Gently stir and enjoy.

26.name: Grizzly Bear
26.instructions: Served over ice. Sounds nasty, but tastes great.

27.name: Clove Cocktail
27.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

28.name: Abilene
28.instructions: Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

29.name: Adam Bomb
29.instructions: Add ice to blender (or to glass if prefer on the rocks) then fruit, and fruite juice depending on personal prefference then add the Rum, Vodka, Tequila, and triple sec. blend till smooth, rim glass with sugar or salt and pour mixture in. garnish with lemon or lime slice.

30.name: Kurant Tea
30.instructions: Pour Absolut Kurant into a comfortably big tea-cup. Add the not too hot(!) apple tea and, if you like, some sugar. Enjoy!

32.name: Queen Bee
32.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

33.name: Chocolate Milk
33.instructions: Put the milk in the bottom, pour the Liquer on top and add the dash of amaretto. Do not mix. SLAM IT!

34.name: Kiwi Papaya Smoothie
34.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.

35.name: Butter Baby
35.instructions: Blend together in a blender. Serve in a chilled Beer mug with Fresh Blueberries and caramel for topping.

36.name: Apple Slammer
36.instructions: pour into a shot glass and present to consumer, they are expected to cover the top of the shotglass with thier palm, raise the glass, slam it on the bar and the swallow quickly.

37.name: Rum Cooler
37.instructions: Pour the rum and soda into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the lemon wedge.

38.name: Just a Moonmint
38.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

39.name: Bellini
39.instructions: Pour peach purée into chilled flute, add sparkling wine. Stir gently.

40.name: Manhattan
40.instructions: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served up.

41.name: Bruised Heart
41.instructions: Pour all ingredients in a mixing tin over ice, stir, and strain into shot glass

42.name: Alice in Wonderland
42.instructions: Just mix the three ingredients one to one to one

43.name: Lassi Raita
43.instructions: Blend the yoghurt and ice cubes together, until the yoghurt becomes more liquid. Add sugar to taste. The lemon/lime is optional but it gives it a slightly tart taste. Dash of salt. Raita is also good for the summer. Instead of having a traditional salad you can make raita instead.

44.name: Bloody Mary
44.instructions: Stirring gently, pour all ingredients into highball glass. Garnish.

45.name: Baby Guinness
45.instructions: Pour Kahlua, almost filling shot glass. Then, carefully pour Baileys, using wall of shot glass. This will give the "Guinness" its "head".

46.name: Gideon's Green Dinosaur
46.instructions: Add all ingredients in collins glass with ice and stir.

47.name: Tequila Surprise
47.instructions: Fill shot glass with Tequila. Add drops of Tobasco sauce.

48.name: Clover Club
48.instructions: Dry shake ingredients to emulsify, add ice, shake and served straight up.

49.name: Casino
49.instructions: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist and a maraschino cherry. Serve without a straw.

51.name: Bora Bora
51.instructions: Prepare in a blender or shaker, serve in a highball glass on the rocks. Garnish with 1 slice of pineapple and one cherry.

52.name: Coffee Liqueur
52.instructions: Combine coffee, sugar and water. Simmer 1 hour and let cool. Add vanilla and vodka. Age in sealed jar 2 to 3 weeks.

53.name: Angelica Liqueur
53.instructions: Combine all herbs, nuts and spices with vodka in a 1 quart or larger aging container. Cap tightly and shake daily for 2 weeks. Strain through a fine muslin cloth or coffee filter, discarding solids. Clean out aging container. Place liquid back in container. Place sugar and water in saucepan and stir to combine over medium heat. When sugar is completely dissolved, set aside and let cool. When cool combine with food coloring and add to liqueur liquid. Cap and allow to age and mellow in a cool, dark place for one month.

54.name: H.D.
54.instructions: Mix the whisky and Baileys Cream in a beer-glass (at least 50 cl). Fill the rest of the glass with coffee.

55.name: AT&T
55.instructions: Pour Vodka and Gin over ice, add Tonic and Stir

56.name: Allegheny
56.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the twist of lemon peel and serve.

57.name: Zambeer
57.instructions: Mix sambuca with rootbeer and stir. Add ice

58.name: Turf Cocktail
58.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.

60.name: Sea breeze
60.instructions: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

61.name: Apple Karate
61.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

62.name: French 75
62.instructions: Combine gin, sugar, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled champagne glass. Top up with Champagne. Stir gently.

63.name: After Supper Cocktail
63.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

64.name: Boulevardier
64.instructions: Stir with ice, strain, garnish and serve.

65.name: Lunch Box
65.instructions: Fill a pint glass almost full with beer. Then fill the rest with orange juice (careful not to fill it to the top). Then take the shot of Amaretto and drop it in.

66.name: Snakebite and Black
66.instructions: Put blackcurrant squash in first up to about 1cm in glass. Then add the larger and cider one after another.

67.name: Talos Coffee
67.instructions: Add your GM and then add your coffee.

69.name: Irish Russian
69.instructions: Add the ingredients in the order listed in the recipe. Care must be taken when adding the Guinness to prevent an excess of foam. Do Not add ice.

70.name: Orgasm
70.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

71.name: Amaretto Rose
71.instructions: Pour amaretto and lime juice over ice in a collins glass. Fill with club soda and serve.

72.name: Loch Lomond
72.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, Drambuie, and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

73.name: Lord And Lady
73.instructions: Pour the rum and Tia Maria into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

74.name: B-52
74.instructions: Layer ingredients into a shot glass. Serve with a stirrer.

75.name: Gluehwein
75.instructions: Boil sugar and spices in water, leave in the water for 30 minutes. Strain the spiced water and mix with the wine. Heat slowly until short of boiling temperature. (To remove alcohol, let it boil for a while.) You may add lemon or orange juice to taste. Serve in irish coffee cup.

76.name: Thai Iced Tea
76.instructions: Combine Thai tea (i.e., the powder), boiling water, and sweetened condensed milk, stir until blended. Pour into 2 tall glasses filled with ice cubes. Garnish with mint leaves. Makes 2 servings.

77.name: Radioactive Long Island Iced Tea
77.instructions: Pour all ingredients over ice in a very tall glass. Sip cautiously.

78.name: Auburn Headbanger
78.instructions: Mix in spread glass over ice. Strain and pour in shot glass. Sit down before shotting. ENJOY!!

79.name: Acapulco
79.instructions: Combine and shake all ingredients (except mint) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the sprig of mint and serve.

80.name: Zima Blaster
80.instructions: Fill glass with ice. Pour in Chambord, then fill with Zima. Mix and enjoy.

81.name: Addison Special
81.instructions: Combine ingredients in the order listed into a shaker. Fill half full with ice and shake well. Strain into glass with ice and garnish with a cherry and orange wedge.

82.name: Limona Corona
82.instructions: Open the Corona. Fill the empty space in the neck in the bottle with the rum. The bottle should be filled to the top. Plug the bottle with your thumb or the palm of your hand. Turn the bottle upside-down so the rum and beer mix. Turn the bottle rightside-up, unplug, and drink.

83.name: Ipamena
83.instructions: Cut half a lime into pieces, place in a shaker, add the sugar and crush. Measure the passion fruit juice, add it to the shaker and fill up with ice cubes. Close the shaker and shake vigorously. Pour the liquid into a glass, top up with ginger ale, stir with a teaspoon and then garnish the rim of the glass with a slice of lime

84.name: Old Pal
84.instructions: Chill cocktail glass. Add ingredients to a mixing glass, and fill 2/3 full with ice. Stir about 20 seconds. Empty cocktail glass and strain into the glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel.

85.name: Tia-Maria
85.instructions: Boil water, sugar and coffe for 10 mins and let cool. Add rum and vanilla. Put in clean bottle(s) and leave for 1 week before using.

86.name: English Highball
86.instructions: Pour brandy, gin, and sweet vermouth into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water. Add the twist of lemon peel, stir, and serve. (Ginger ale may be substituted for carbonated water, if preferred.)

87.name: Valencia Cocktail
87.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

88.name: Cuba Libre
88.instructions: Build all ingredients in a Collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

89.name: Space Odyssey
89.instructions: Fill glass with ice and add shots of Bacardi and Malibu. Add splash of pineapple juice and top with orange juice. Add grenadine for color and garnish with cherries.

90.name: Zombie
90.instructions:
Blend at high speed for no more than 5 seconds.

Pour into a glass, add ice cubes to fill, then add the garnish.

*Donn’s mix: Bring 3 crushed cinnamon sticks, 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of water to a boil, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.

Simmer for 2 minutes, then remove from the heat and let sit for at least 2 hours before straining into a clean glass bottle.

Then add 1 part of the syrup and 2 parts of fresh grapefruit juice together.

91.name: Boomerang
91.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, vermouth, bitters, and maraschino liqueur. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry.

92.name: Gin Swizzle
92.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the lime juice, sugar, gin, and bitters. Shake well. Almost fill a colling glass with ice cubes. Stir until the glass is frosted. Strain the mixture in the shaker into the glass and add the club soda.

93.name: ACID
93.instructions: Poor in the 151 first followed by the 101 served with a Coke or Dr Pepper chaser.

94.name: Imperial Cocktail
94.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

95.name: Zoksel
95.instructions: No specific mixinginstructions, just poor every ingredient in one glass. The lemon goes with it.

96.name: Zorro
96.instructions: add all and pour black coffee and add whipped cream on top.

97.name: Tequila Fizz
97.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except ginger ale) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.

98.name: Vampiro
98.instructions: Vampiros may be made in a tall glass or an old fashioned glass. Bartenders may first "rim" the glass with Kosher Salt, which is done by placing a layer of Kosher Salt on a chopping board, moistening the glass' rim with lime juice or water, and then placing the upside down glass rim onto the Kosher Salt, so that the salt sticks to the moistened rim. The second step is to fill half the glass with ice and add one or two shooter glasses full of high quality Tequila. The next stage is to add the flavouring elements. This is done by squeezing a fresh lime into the glass, adding a few grains of salt, adding citrus-flavoured soda pop, until the glass is 4/5 full, and then adding spicy Viuda de Sanchez (or orange juice, lime juice and pico de gallo). The final step is to stir the ingredients so that the flavours are properly blended.

99.name: Yellow Bird
99.instructions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass

100.name: Arise My Love
100.instructions: Put creme de menthe into a champagne flute. Fill with chilled champagne and serve.

101.name: Smut
101.instructions: Throw it all together and serve real cold.

102.name: City Slicker
102.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

103.name: Spiking coffee
103.instructions: Incidentally, a pinch of cinnamon is indeed a nice addition to coffee but true heaven is a cardamom seed. Of course, you serve it in a coffee mug.

104.name: Sweet Sangria
104.instructions: Dissolve the sugar in hot water and cool. Peel the citrus fruits and break into wedges. Mix the wine, sugar syrup, fruit, and Fresca in a pitcher and put in the fridge for a few hours. Serve in tall glasses with a straw.

105.name: Vodka Martini
105.instructions: Shake the vodka and vermouth together with a number of ice cubes, strain into a cocktail glass, add the olive and serve.

106.name: Mint Julep
106.instructions: In a highball glass gently muddle the mint, sugar and water. Fill the glass with cracked ice, add Bourbon and stir well until the glass is well frosted. Garnish with a mint sprig.

107.name: White Russian
107.instructions: Pour vodka and coffee liqueur over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass. Fill with light cream and serve.

108.name: Hunter's Moon
108.instructions: Put the Bombay Sapphire, Martini Bianco, sugar syrup & blackberries in a cocktail shaker with lots of ice and shake vigorously before pouring into a balloon glass, topping up with lemonade and garnishing with a wedge of orange.

109.name: Coffee-Vodka
109.instructions: Boil water and sugar until dissolved. Turn off heat. Slowly add dry instant coffee and continue stirring. Add a chopped vanilla bean to the vodka, then combine the cooled sugar syrup and coffee solution with the vodka. Cover tightly and shake vigorously each day for 3 weeks. Strain and filter. Its also best to let the sugar mixture cool completely so the vodka won't evaporate when its added. If you like a smoother feel to the liqueur you can add about 1 teaspoon of glycerine to the finished product.

110.name: GG
110.instructions: Pour the Galliano liqueur over ice. Fill the remainder of the glass with ginger ale and thats all there is to it. You now have a your very own GG.

111.name: Jack Rose Cocktail
111.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

112.name: Singapore Sling
112.instructions: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into highball glass. Garnish with pineapple and cocktail cherry.

113.name: New York Sour
113.instructions: Shake blended whiskey, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Float claret on top. Decorate with the half-slice of lemon and the cherry and serve.

114.name: Flying Dutchman
114.instructions: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and triple sec. Stir well.

115.name: Radler
115.instructions: Pour beer into large mug, slowly add the 7-up (or Sprite).

116.name: Flaming Lamborghini
116.instructions: Pour the Sambuca and Kahlua into the Cocktail Glass and give the drinker a straw. Pour the Baileys and Blue Curacao into two sepsrate shot glasses either side of the cocktail glass. Set light the concotion in the cocktail glass and start to drink through the straw (this drink should be drunk in one) , as the bottom of the glass is reached put out the fire by pouring the Baileys and Blue Curacao into the cocktail glass and keep drinking till it's all gone!!

117.name: Mojito
117.instructions: Muddle mint leaves with sugar and lime juice. Add a splash of soda water and fill the glass with cracked ice. Pour the rum and top with soda water. Garnish and serve with straw.

118.name: Zippy's Revenge
118.instructions: Mix Kool-Aid to taste then add Rum and ammaretto. shake well to disolve the sugar in the Kool-Aid... serve cold

119.name: Scotch Sour
119.instructions: Shake scotch, juice of lime, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with 1/2 slice lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

120.name: French Negroni
120.instructions:
Add ice to a shaker and pour in all ingredients.
Using a bar spoon, stir 40 to 45 revolutions or until thoroughly chilled.
Strain into a martini glass or over ice into a rocks glass. Garnish with orange twist.

121.name: Dragonfly
121.instructions: In a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and ginger ale. Stir well. Garnish with the lime wedge.

122.name: Champagne Cocktail
122.instructions: Add dash of Angostura bitter onto sugar cube and drop it into champagne flute. Add cognac followed by gently pouring chilled champagne. Garnish with orange slice and maraschino cherry.

123.name: Autodafé
123.instructions: Mix and fill up with soda water. Drunk by finns on a sunny day any time of the year and day.

124.name: Brave Bull Shooter
124.instructions: Pour Tabasco into bottom of shot glass and fill with tequila.

125.name: Algonquin
125.instructions: Combine and shake all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.

126.name: Bijou
126.instructions: Stir in mixing glass with ice and strain

127.name: Barracuda
127.instructions: Shake pour ingredients with ice. Strain into glass, top with Sparkling wine.

128.name: Allies Cocktail
128.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.

129.name: Fuzzy Asshole
129.instructions: fill coffe mug half full of coffee. Fill the other half full of Peach Schnapps. Stir and drink while hot.

130.name: Strawberry Daiquiri
130.instructions: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail glass.

131.name: Daiquiri
131.instructions: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail glass.

132.name: Kentucky B And B
132.instructions: Pour the bourbon and Benedictine into a brandy snifter.

133.name: Cosmopolitan
133.instructions: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and double strain into large cocktail glass. Garnish with lime wheel.

134.name: Long vodka
134.instructions: Shake a tall glass with ice cubes and Angostura, coating the inside of the glass. Por the vodka onto this, add 1 slice of lime and squeeze juice out of remainder, mix with tonic, stir and voila you have a Long Vodka

135.name: Bible Belt
135.instructions: Mix all ingredients, and pour over ice.

136.name: Gin Cooler
136.instructions: Stir powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice and add gin. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the lemon peel and the orange spiral so that the end of the orange spiral dangles over rim of glass.

137.name: Angel Face
137.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass.

138.name: Sangria #1
138.instructions: Mix all together in a pitcher and refrigerate. Add cloves and cinnamon sticks to taste. Serve in wine glasses.

139.name: Caipirissima
139.instructions: Same as Caipirinha but instead of cachaca you add WHITE RUM. It's great!!!!!!!!

140.name: Kool-Aid Shot
140.instructions: Pour into a large glass with ice and stir. Add a little cranberry juice to taste.

141.name: Apricot punch
141.instructions: Pour all ingrediants into a large punch bowl. Add ice and 4 oranges that are peeled and divided.

142.name: Waikiki Beachcomber
142.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

143.name: Grass Skirt
143.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, triple sec, pineapple juice, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the pineapple slice.

144.name: Wine Cooler
144.instructions: Mix wine and soft drink. Pour into glass. Add ice.

145.name: Cafe Savoy
145.instructions: Fill mug almost to top with coffee.Add milk, triple sec and brandy. Stir.

146.name: Happy Skipper
146.instructions: Pour Captain Morgan's Spiced Rum over ice, fill glass to top with Ginger Ale. Garnish with lime. Tastes like a cream soda. Named for the Gilligan's Island reference ("The Captain" *in* "Ginger" is a Happy Skipper!)

147.name: Whiskey Sour
147.instructions: Shake with ice. Strain into chilled glass, garnish and serve. If served 'On the rocks', strain ingredients into old-fashioned glass filled with ice.

148.name: Rose
148.instructions: Shake together in a cocktail shaker, then strain into chilled glass. Garnish and serve.

149.name: Vermouth Cassis
149.instructions: Stir vermouth and creme de cassis in a highball glass with ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir again, and serve.

150.name: Planter's Punch
150.instructions: Pour all ingredients, except the bitters, into shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Pour into large glass, filled with ice. Add Angostura bitters, "on top". Garnish with cocktail cherry and pineapple.

151.name: Amaretto Stinger
151.instructions: Shake ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

152.name: Brandy Sour
152.instructions: Shake brandy, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with the lemon slice, top with the cherry, and serve.

153.name: Espresso Martini
153.instructions: Pour ingredients into shaker filled with ice, shake vigorously, and strain into chilled martini glass

154.name: Tipperary
154.instructions: Stir over ice. Strain into chilled glass. Cut a wide swath of orange peel, and express the orange oils over the drink. Discard orange twist.

155.name: Paloma
155.instructions: Stir together and serve over ice.

156.name: Jamaican Coffee
156.instructions: Stir the rum, coffee and water together. Top with the whipped cream. Sprinkle with a pinch of well ground coffee and drink with a straw.

157.name: Affair
157.instructions: Pour schnapps, orange juice, and cranberry juice over ice in a highball glass. Top with club soda and serve.

158.name: Apple Cider Punch #1
158.instructions: If you use the whole all spice and cloves, tie them in cheesecloth. Heat the mixture. Stir occasionally. If you want an alcoholic drink, rum would be nice.

159.name: Adam
159.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

160.name: Almeria
160.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

161.name: Microwave Hot Cocoa
161.instructions: Combine sugar, cocoa, salt and hot water in 1-quart micro-proof measuring cup (or coffee mug). Microwave at HIGH (100%) for 1 to 1 1/2 minutes or until boiling. Add milk, sitr and microwave an additonal 1 1/2 to 2 minutes or until hot. Stir in vanilla, blend well.

162.name: Thai Coffee
162.instructions: Place the coffee and spices in the filter cone of your coffee maker. Brew coffee as usual, let it cool. In a tall glass, dissolve 1 or 2 teaspoons of sugar in an ounce of the coffee (it's easier to dissolve than if you put it right over ice). Add 5-6 ice cubes and pour coffee to within about 1 inch of the top of the glass. Rest a spoon on top of the coffee and slowly pour whipping cream into the spoon. This will make the cream float on top of the coffee rather than dispersing into it right away.

163.name: Damned if you do
163.instructions: Pour into shot glass. Put in mouth. Repeat as deemed necessary.

164.name: Blue Lagoon
164.instructions: Pour vodka and curacao over ice in a highball glass. Fill with lemonade, top with the cherry, and serve.

165.name: Bubble Gum
165.instructions: Layer in order into a shot glass.

166.name: Baby Eskimo
166.instructions: Leave ice-cream out for about 10 minutes. Add ingredients in order, stir with chopstick (butter knife or spoon works too). Consume immediately and often. Nice and light, great for following a heavy drink.

167.name: Zizi Coin-coin
167.instructions: Pour 5cl of Cointreau on ice, add 2cl of fresh lemon (or lime) juice, stir gently, and finally add slices of lemon/lime in glass.

168.name: Gin Sling
168.instructions: Dissolve powdered sugar in mixture of water and juice of lemon. Add gin. Pour into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes and stir. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.

169.name: Shark Attack
169.instructions: Mix lemonade and water according to instructions on back of can. If the instructions say to add 4 1/3 cans of water do so. Mix into pitcher. Add 1 1/2 cup of Vodka (Absolut). Mix well. Pour into glass of crushed ice. Excellent!

170.name: Lady Love Fizz
170.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

171.name: San Francisco
171.instructions: Take a tall glass and put in a few ice cubes, fill the vodka over it and fill with juice then the "creme", to end fill in the grenadine but very carefully at the side of the glass so it will lay down in the bottom. garnish with orange and strawberry.

172.name: Campari Beer
172.instructions: Use a 15 oz glass. Add Campari first. Fill with beer.

173.name: Malibu Twister
173.instructions: Add rum & trister then, add cranberry jucie,stir

174.name: Citrus Coke
174.instructions: Pour half of coke in a glass. Then add Bacardi and top it off with the remaining coke. Stir and drink up!

175.name: Egg Cream
175.instructions: Mix syrup and milk in a fountain glass. Add soda water, serve with a straw.

177.name: Absolut limousine
177.instructions: Fill Absolut into a glass. Add Lime juice. Add Ice and lime wedges.

178.name: Alexander
178.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

179.name: Jitterbug
179.instructions: Wet glass, dip rim in sugar. Then add Ice. Then add everything else. It's that simple!

180.name: Absolutly Screwed Up
180.instructions: Shake it up it tasts better that way, but you can stir it if you want. 6 of those and you will be wasted for the rest of the night.

181.name: Apple Berry Smoothie
181.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.

182.name: Texas Rattlesnake
182.instructions: Mix all ingredients and Shake well. Sweet at first, with a BITE at the end...

183.name: Fahrenheit 5000
183.instructions: Cover bottom of shot glass with Tabasco Sauce and then fill with half Firewater and half Absolut Peppar.

184.name: Bumble Bee #1
184.instructions: This is a layered shot. First pour the Bailey's into the shot glass. Then take an upside down spoon and touch it to the inside wall of the glass. Carefully add the Kahlua. Repeat this process for the Sambuca. If done properly, the alcohol will stay separated and resemble a bumble bee. Enjoy!!!

185.name: Gentleman's Club
185.instructions: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well.

186.name: Amaretto Tea
186.instructions: Pour hot tea into a pousse-cafe glass, using a spoon in glass to prevent cracking. Add amaretto, but do not stir. Top with chilled whipped cream and serve.

187.name: Zipperhead
187.instructions: Fill glass with rocks, add straw before putting in liquor. Then add the ingredients in order, trying to keep layered as much as possible (i.e. Chambord on bottom, then Vodka, Then soda on top).

188.name: Affinity
188.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

189.name: Boston Sidecar
189.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

190.name: Irish Cream
190.instructions: Mix scotch and milk. Add half-and-half. Add rest.

191.name: Midnight Cowboy
191.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

192.name: Amaretto Stone Sour #3
192.instructions: Shake sour mix, tequila and amaretto with ice. Strain into highball glass. Add a splash of OJ. Garnish with orange slice and a cherry.

193.name: Bluebird
193.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine the gin, triple sec, Curacao, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist and the cherry.

194.name: Veteran
194.instructions: Pour the rum and cherry brandy into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

195.name: Irish Coffee
195.instructions: Heat the coffee, whiskey and sugar; do not boil. Pour into glass and top with cream; serve hot.

196.name: Mojito #3
196.instructions: Put mint with lemon juice in a glas, mash the mint with a spoon, ice, rum & fill up with club soda. Top it with Angostura.

197.name: Casino Royale
197.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.

198.name: Tuxedo Cocktail
198.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry and a twist of lemon zest.

199.name: Orange Whip
199.instructions: Pour ingredients over ice and stir.

200.name: Lemon Shot
200.instructions: Mix Galliano and Absolut Citron in a shot glass, lay lemon wedge sprinkled with sugar over glass and pour a rum over wedge and glass. light rum with a lighter and let burn for a second. Do shot quickly and suck on lemon. If it is done correctly, this will taste like a shot of sweet lemonade.

201.name: Bermuda Highball
201.instructions: Pour brandy, gin, and dry vermouth into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the twist of lemon and serve. (Ginger ale may be substituted for carbonated water, if preferred.)

202.name: Royal Flush
202.instructions: Pour all the ingredients into tumbler over ice. Strain into glass.

203.name: Sazerac
203.instructions: Rinse a chilled old-fashioned glass with the absinthe, add crushed ice, and set it aside. Stir the remaining ingredients over ice and set it aside. Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared glass, and strain the drink into the glass. Add the lemon peel for garnish.

204.name: Masala Chai
204.instructions: Bring 2 cups of water to boil. Add all the ingredients and boil again for about 15 seconds. Let stand for a minute. Warm milk in a pot. Filter tea into cups. Add milk and sugar. That's IT.

205.name: Yoghurt Cooler
205.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up. Note: Use lots of ice in this one - great on hot days! To add ice: Remove the center of the cover while the blender is on - drop 3 or 4 ice cubs and blend until they're completely crushed.

206.name: Quarter Deck Cocktail
206.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

207.name: Sidecar Cocktail
207.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

208.name: Martinez Cocktail
208.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.

209.name: Bobby Burns Cocktail
209.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

210.name: Egg Nog - Healthy
210.instructions: Whip egg substitute and sugar together, combine with the two kinds of milk, vanilla, and rum. Mix well. Chill over night. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Makes 6 servings.

211.name: Kentucky Colonel
211.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes combine the courbon and Benedictine. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

212.name: Wine Punch
212.instructions: Combine all of the ingredients and pour over a block of ice.

213.name: Absolut Stress #2
213.instructions: Mix well. Garnish with Orange and Cherry. Enjoy

214.name: Amaretto Sunset
214.instructions: Shake ingredients in bartender's mixer quickly, just 5 shakes. Strain out ice, serve in glass immediately with a slice of orange.

215.name: Pink Gin
215.instructions: Pour the bitters into a wine glass. Swirl the glass to coat the inside with the bitters, shake out the excess. Pour the gin into the glass. Do not add ice.

216.name: Dark Caipirinha
216.instructions:
Muddle the sugar into the lime wedges in an old-fashioned glass.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Pour the cachaca into the glass.
Stir well.

217.name: Greyhound
217.instructions:
Add the vodka to a Collins glass filled with ice.
Top with grapefruit juice and stir.

218.name: Bailey's Dream Shake
218.instructions: Blend ingredients for 30 seconds. Definitely refreshing for a hot summer's day !

219.name: Ziemes Martini Apfelsaft
219.instructions: Serve without ice. At least the juice shold have room temperature.

220.name: Tommy's Margarita
220.instructions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

221.name: Adios Amigos Cocktail
221.instructions: Shake together all the ingredients and strain into a cold glass.

222.name: The Jimmy Conway
222.instructions:
Fill glass with ice
Pour in The Irishman and Disaronno
Fill to the top with Cranberry Juice
Garnish with a slice of lemon…Enjoy!

223.name: Banana Daiquiri
223.instructions: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail glass.

224.name: Rail Splitter
224.instructions: Mix sugar syrup with lemon juice in a tall glass. Fill up with ginger ale.

226.name: French Martini
226.instructions: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink.

227.name: Apple Grande
227.instructions: Chill both ingredients!! Mix in a tumbler and enjoy!

228.name: Black Russian
228.instructions: Pour the ingredients into an old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

229.name: Gin Toddy
229.instructions: Mix powdered sugar and water in an old-fashioned glass. Add gin and one ice cube. Stir, add the twist of lemon peel, and serve.

230.name: Oatmeal Cookie
230.instructions:
Just mix it all together.
It's meant to be a shot, but it works just fine as a proper adult-sized drink over lots of ice.

Tastes like an oatmeal cookie.

231.name: Turkeyball
231.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a shot glass.

232.name: Victory Collins
232.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of orange and serve.

233.name: London Town
233.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

234.name: Hot Chocolate to Die for
234.instructions: Melt the chocolate, butter and vanilla in a double boiler. When just smooth stir in the cream.

235.name: Imperial Fizz
235.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

236.name: Addison
236.instructions: Shake together all the ingredients and strain into a cold glass.

237.name: Kool-Aid Slammer
237.instructions: Fill half the shot glass with the kool-aid first. Then put a paper towel over the top of the glass and slowly pour in the vodka. If you do it right, you should be able to see that the two liquids are separated, with the vodka on top. Now slam it! The last thing you'll taste is the kool-aid.

238.name: Cranberry Punch
238.instructions: Combine first four ingredients. Stir until sugar is dissolved, chill. Then add ginger ale just before serving. Add ice ring to keep punch cold.

239.name: Kioki Coffee
239.instructions: Stir. Add whipped cream to the top.

240.name: French Connection
240.instructions: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

241.name: Old Fashioned
241.instructions:
Place sugar cube in old fashioned glass and saturate with bitters, add a dash of plain water. Muddle until dissolved.
Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whiskey.

Garnish with orange twist, and a cocktail cherry.

242.name: Girl From Ipanema
242.instructions: Add the cachaca, lemon juice and syrup to your boston glass. Add ice and shake until ice cold. Pour into a chilled flute and top-up with Champagne

243.name: Tomato Tang
243.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

244.name: Jack's Vanilla Coke
244.instructions: After pouring in your ingredients, and adding 3-5 ice cubes, according to taste. Stir the drink with a stirrer to get the Vanilla off the bottom.

245.name: Sherry Eggnog
245.instructions: Shake sherry, powdered sugar, and egg with ice and strain into a collins glass. Fill with milk and stir. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

246.name: Scooter
246.instructions: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

247.name: Fruit Cooler
247.instructions: Toss strawberries with sugar, and let sit overnight in refrigerator. Cut lemon, reserve two slices. Juice the rest. Mix together the lemon juice, strawberries, apple juice, and soda water. Add slices of lemon (decor, really). In glasses, put ice cubes, and a slice of apple. Pour drink in, and serve.

248.name: Gin Rickey
248.instructions: Half-fill a tall glass with ice. Mix the gin and Grenadine together and pour over the ice. Add the lime or lemon juice and top off with soda water. Decorate the glass with lime and/or lemon slices.

249.name: Blue Margarita
249.instructions: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lime juice. Dip rim in coarse salt. Shake tequila, blue curacao, and lime juice with ice, strain into the salt-rimmed glass, and serve.

250.name: Spritz
250.instructions: Build into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

251.name: The Last Word
251.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.

252.name: Amaretto Shake
252.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend at high speed until smooth. Serve in chilled glass garnished with bittersweet chocolate shavings.

253.name: Grim Reaper
253.instructions: Mix Kahlua and 151 in glass. Quickly add ice and pour grenadine over ice to give ice red tint.

254.name: Iced Coffee
254.instructions: Mix together until coffee and sugar is dissolved. Add milk. Shake well. Using a blender or milk shake maker produces a very foamy drink. Serve in coffee mug.

255.name: Brandy Flip
255.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the brandy, egg, sugar, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the nutmeg.

256.name: A1
256.instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, mix and serve over ice into a chilled glass.

257.name: Bob Marley
257.instructions: Layer in a 2 oz shot glass or pony glass

258.name: Flying Scotchman
258.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

259.name: Abbey Cocktail
259.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except for the cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.

260.name: Almond Joy
260.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

261.name: English Rose Cocktail
261.instructions: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lemon juice and dip rim of glass in powdered sugar. Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into sugar-rimmed glass. Top with the cherry and serve.

262.name: Drinking Chocolate
262.instructions: Heat the cream and milk with the cinnamon and vanilla bean very slowly for 15-20 minutes. (If you don't have any beans add 1-2 tsp of vanilla after heating). Remove the bean and cinnamon. Add the chocolate. Mix until fully melted. Serve topped with some very dense fresh whipped cream. Serves 1-2 depending upon how much of a glutton you are. For a richer chocolate, use 4 oz of milk, 4 oz of cream, 4 oz of chocolate. Serve in coffee mug.

263.name: Hawaiian Cocktail
263.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

264.name: Royal Fizz
264.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cola) with ice and strain into a chilled collins glass. Fill with cola and serve.

265.name: Irish Spring
265.instructions: Pour all ingredients (except orange slice and cherry) into a collins glass over ice cubes. Garnish with the slice of orange, add the cherry on top, and serve.

266.name: Spiced Peach Punch
266.instructions: Combine peach nectar, orange juice and brown sugar in a large saucepan. Tie cinnamon and cloves in a small cheesecloth bag. Drop into saucepan. Heat slowly, stirring constantly, until sugar dissolves. Simmer 10 minutes. Stir in lime juice. Serve in hot mugs.

267.name: Rosemary Blue
267.instructions:
1) Add the Bombay Sapphire, Blue Curacao, rosemary sprig and gently squeezed lemon wedge to a balloon glass. Swirl well to combine.
2) Fill with cubed ice and top with the Fever-Tree Light Tonic Water.
3) Gently fold with a bar spoon to mix.

268.name: Jewel Of The Nile
268.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

269.name: National Aquarium
269.instructions: Pour all ingredients into a shaker of ice. Shake well. Serve on the rocks.

270.name: Bourbon Sour
270.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a whiskey sour glass, garnish with the orange slice and cherry.

272.name: Mai Tai
272.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain into glass. Garnish and serve with straw.

273.name: Blackthorn
273.instructions: Stir sloe gin and vermouth with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

274.name: Alabama Slammer
274.instructions: Pour all ingredients (except for lemon juice) over ice in a highball glass. Stir, add a dash of lemon juice, and serve.

275.name: Chocolate Beverage
275.instructions: Boil milk in the top of a deep double boiler five minutes. Remove from fire and add chocolate, mixed with the cinnamon, a little at a time, beating with molinillo or egg beater after each addition. When the chocolate is thoroughly blended, heat to the boiling point. Place over bottom of double boiler and add eggs, whipping constantly, until they are thoroughly blended and the mixture is frothing. Serve in coffee mug. Serves eight.

276.name: Rum Cobbler
276.instructions: In an old-fashioned glass, dissolve the sugar in the club soda. Add crushed ice until the glass is almost full. Add the rum. Stir well. Garnish with the cherry and the orange and lemon slices.

277.name: Pink Lady
277.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

278.name: Port Wine Flip
278.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

279.name: Rum Milk Punch
279.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

280.name: Blue Hurricane
280.instructions:
If each part is 1/2 oz then use about 2.5 cups of ice.

Blend it all together. 
Drink it with a big straw if you have one.

281.name: Whisky Mac
281.instructions: Pour both of the ingredients into a wine goblet with no ice.

282.name: Cherry Electric Lemonade
282.instructions: Now stir vigorously and then pour over a large cup of ice. Now drink it with a straw and stir occasionally.

283.name: Corpse Reviver #2
283.instructions: Shake, strain, straight up, cocktail glass rinsed with absinthe

284.name: Dubonnet Cocktail
284.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

285.name: Arizona Twister
285.instructions: Just mix in the shots of rum, vodka, and tequila. Add splashes of the three juices, heavy on the pineapple. Top off with grenadine. Crushed ice should already be in glass. Top off the glass with a pineapple wedge.

286.name: Stinger
286.instructions: Pour in a mixing glass with ice, stir and strain into a cocktail glass. May also be served on rocks in a rocks glass.

287.name: Cosmopolitan Martini
287.instructions: Pour all ingredients in mixing glass half filled with ice, shake and strain into chilled Martini glass.

288.name: Screwdriver
288.instructions: Mix in a highball glass with ice. Garnish and serve.

289.name: Rusty Nail
289.instructions: Pour the Scotch and Drambuie into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lemon twist.

290.name: Abbey Martini
290.instructions: Put all ingredients into a shaker and mix, then strain contents into a chilled cocktail glass.

291.name: Blue Mountain
291.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass alomst filled with ice cubes.

292.name: Red Snapper
292.instructions: One shot each, shake n shoot

293.name: Dirty Martini
293.instructions:
Pour the vodka, dry vermouth and olive brine into a cocktail shaker with a handful of ice and shake well.
Rub the rim of a martini glass with the wedge of lemon.
Strain the contents of the cocktail shaker into the glass and add the olive.
A dirty Martini contains a splash of olive brine or olive juice and is typically garnished with an olive.

294.name: Mocha-Berry
294.instructions: pour 6 oz. of coffee in a mug or Irish coffee cup. add coca mix and chambord, mix well and top off with whipped cream.

295.name: Orangeade
295.instructions: Place some ice cubes in a large tumbler or highball glass, add lemon juice, orange juice, sugar syrup, and stir well. Top up with cold soda water, serve with a drinking straw.

296.name: Sol Y Sombra
296.instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a brandy snifter, and serve. (The English translation of the name of this drink is "Sun and Shade", and after sampling this drink, you'll understand why. Thanks, Kirby.)

297.name: Porto flip
297.instructions: Shake ingredients together in a mixer with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve.

298.name: Rum Old-fashioned
298.instructions: Stir powdered sugar, water, and bitters in an old-fashioned glass. When sugar has dissolved add ice cubes and light rum. Add the twist of lime peel, float 151 proof rum on top, and serve.

299.name: Godmother
299.instructions: Pour vodka and amaretto into an old-fashioned glass over ice and serve.

300.name: Mimosa
300.instructions: Ensure both ingredients are well chilled, then mix into the glass. Serve cold.

301.name: Lassi - A South Indian Drink
301.instructions: Blend in a blender for 3 seconds. Lassi is one of the easiest things to make, and there are many ways of making it. Basically, it is buttermilk (yoghurt whisked with water), and you can choose almost any consistency that you like, from the thinnest to the thickest. Serve cold.

302.name: Quick F**K
302.instructions: In a shot glass add 1/3 Kahlua first. Then 1/3 Miduri, topping it off with a 1/3 bailey's irish cream

303.name: Amaretto And Cream
303.instructions: Shake well with cracked ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.

304.name: Black and Brown
304.instructions: CAREFULLY to avoid explosive head formation: Pour Beer glass half full of favorite rootbeer and top off with Guinness.

305.name: Raspberry Cooler
305.instructions: Pour the raspberry vodka and soda into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

306.name: Pisco Sour
306.instructions: Vigorously shake and strain contents in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, then pour into glass and garnish with bitters.[1]

307.name: Kir
307.instructions: Add the crème de cassis to the bottom of the glass, then top up with wine.

308.name: Tequila Sunrise
308.instructions: Pour the tequila and orange juice into glass over ice. Add the grenadine, which will sink to the bottom. Stir gently to create the sunrise effect. Garnish and serve.

309.name: Bombay Cassis
309.instructions:
Add the Bombay Sapphire, Crème de Cassis and lime juice to a balloon glass and swirl well to mix.
Fill the glass with good quality cubed ice.
Top up with chilled and freshly opened Fever-Tree Ginger Beer.
Gently stir to combine, top with a gently squeezed lime wedge and finish with a fresh ginger slice.

310.name: Harvey Wallbanger
310.instructions: Stir the vodka and orange juice with ice in the glass, then float the Galliano on top. Garnish and serve.

311.name: Hemingway Special
311.instructions: Pour all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake.

312.name: Zorbatini
312.instructions: Prepare like a Martini. Garnish with a green olive.

313.name: Paradise
313.instructions: Shake together over ice. Strain into cocktail glass and serve chilled.

314.name: Vodka Russian
314.instructions: Mix it as a ordinary drink .

315.name: Grape lemon pineapple Smoothie
315.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.

316.name: Freddy Kruger
316.instructions: make it an ample size shot!!

317.name: Midnight Manx
317.instructions: Fill a mixer with ice and add Baileys, Kahlua, Goldshlager, and cream. Shake for 5 seconds and Strain into a double rocks glass filled with ice. Add chilled coffee Stir and enjoy!

318.name: Mulled Wine
318.instructions: Simmer 3 cups water with, sugar, cloves, cinnamon sticks, and lemon peel in a stainless steel pot for 10 minutes. Add wine heat to a "coffee temperature" (DO NOT BOIL) then add the brandy.

319.name: Sidecar
319.instructions: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass.

320.name: Port And Starboard
320.instructions: Pour carefully into a pousse-cafe glass, so that creme de menthe floats on grenadine. Serve without mixing.

321.name: Salted Toffee Martini
321.instructions:
Add ice, toffee gin, chocolate liqueur and Amaretto to a cocktail shaker and shake vigorously. 
Pour the chocolate syrup into a saucer and dip the top of a martini glass into the sauce. Grate some of the Willie\'s sea salt chocolate into another saucer and dip the coated glass, so the flakes stick to the sauce, creating a chocolate rim!
Pour the contents of the shaker into your chocolatey glass and sprinkle with more grated chocolate - enjoy!

322.name: Brandy Alexander
322.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

323.name: B-53
323.instructions: Layer the Kahlua, Sambucca and Grand Marnier into a shot glas in that order. Better than B-52

324.name: Snowball
324.instructions: Place one ice cube in the glass and add 1 1/2 oz of Advocaat. Fill up the glass with lemonade and decorate with a slice of lemon. Serve at once.

325.name: Brainteaser
325.instructions: layered erin first, then sambuca and then avocart(should sit in middle of other two. To drink: use a straw to suck up avocart then shot the rest and then suck fumes up through straw.

326.name: Holloween Punch
326.instructions: Take a bunch of grape juice and a bunch of fizzy stuff (club soda, ginger ale, lemonlime, whatever). Mix them in a punch bowl. Take orange sherbet and lime sherbet. Scoop out scoops and float them in the punch, let them melt a little so that a nasty film spreads all over the top of the punch but there are still "bubbles" in it in the form of sherbet scoops. Looks horrible, tastes just fine.

327.name: The Laverstoke
327.instructions:
1) Squeeze two lime wedges into a balloon glass then add the cordial, Bombay Sapphire and MARTINI Rosso Vermouth, swirl to mix.

2) Fully fill the glass with cubed ice and stir to chill.

3) Top with Fever-Tree Ginger Ale and gently stir again to combine.

4) Garnish with a snapped ginger slice and an awoken mint sprig.

328.name: Lone Tree Cocktail
328.instructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

329.name: Frozen Pineapple Daiquiri
329.instructions: Combine all ingredients with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a champagne flute and serve.

330.name: Ice Pick #1
330.instructions: Put Vodka in glass fill with iced tea. Stir in lemon to taste.

331.name: Scotch Cobbler
331.instructions: Pour scotch, brandy, and curacao over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Add the orange slice, top with the mint sprig, and serve.

332.name: Rum Screwdriver
332.instructions: Pour rum into a highball glass over ice cubes. Add orange juice, stir, and serve.

333.name: Long Island Iced Tea
333.instructions: Mix all contents in a highball glass and sitr gently. Add dash of Coca-Cola for the coloring and garnish with lemon or lime twist.

334.name: Mary Pickford
334.instructions: Shake and strain into a chilled large cocktail glass

335.name: Vodka And Tonic
335.instructions: Pour vodka into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with tonic water, stir, and serve.

336.name: Lassi Khara
336.instructions: Blend (frappe) in blender until frothy. Add torn curry leaves and serve cold.

337.name: Adam Sunrise
337.instructions: Fill blender up with ice. Fill half with Bartons Vodka. Put 10 tsp of sugar, add 1/2 can lemonade concentrate, fill to top with water. Blend for 60 seconds.

338.name: Arthur Tompkins
338.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, Grand Marnier, and lemon juice. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the lemon twist.

339.name: Rum Runner
339.instructions: Mix all ingredients in glass & add ice.

340.name: Thai Iced Coffee
340.instructions: Prepare a pot of coffee at a good European strength. In the ground coffee, add 2 or 3 freshly ground cardamom pods. Sweeten while hot, then cool quickly. Serve in highball glass over ice, with cream. To get the layered effect, place a spoon atop the coffee and pour the milk carefully into the spoon so that it floats on the top of the coffee.

342.name: Sex on the Beach
342.instructions: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with orange slice.

343.name: Sweet Bananas
343.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

344.name: Absolut Sex
344.instructions: Shake Absolut Kurant, Midori, and Cranberry juice in shaker with ice: Strain into rocks glass: Splash of seven on top.Absolut Sex.

345.name: Jam Donut
345.instructions: Coat the rim of a shot glass with sugar using sugar syrup to stick. Add the Chambord raspberry liqueur to the shot glass, and carefully layer the Baileys Irish Cream on top. Serve.

346.name: Strawberry Lemonade
346.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and mix until fairly smooth. Serve over ice.

347.name: Mango Orange Smoothie
347.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.

348.name: Downshift
348.instructions: Start with the Sprite. Next comes the tequila. After that, add the Minute Maid Fruit Punch, then float the 151. Rocks optional.

349.name: Flaming Dr. Pepper
349.instructions: Add Amaretto, Bacardi, and vodka. Mix in the Dr. Pepper and beer

350.name: Lassi - Sweet
350.instructions: Put all ingredients into a blender and blend until nice and frothy. Serve chilled.

351.name: Port Wine Cocktail
351.instructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

352.name: Corn n Oil
352.instructions: Cut the half lime in half again. Add the lime, falernum, and bitters to a rocks glass. Muddle. Add the rum. (Aged Barbados rum such as Plantation 5 Year is recommended). Add ice and stir. Float the blackstrap rum on top. Serve with a straw.

353.name: Bellini Martini
353.instructions:
Add ice cubes to shaker.
Add vodka.
Add peach schnapps.
Add peach nectar.
Shake.
Strain into glass.
Add lemon twist peel.

354.name: California Lemonade
354.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a collins glass over shaved ice. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Decorate with slices of orange and lemon. Add the cherry and serve with a straw.

355.name: The Evil Blue Thing
355.instructions: Pour ingredients into glass, and drop in a blue whale! The blue whale isn't really necessary, but it makes the drink more "fun".

356.name: Melya
356.instructions: Brew espresso. In a coffee mug, place 1 teaspoon of unsweetened powdered cocoa, then cover a teaspoon with honey and drizzle it into the cup. Stir while the coffee brews, this is the fun part. The cocoa seems to coat the honey without mixing, so you get a dusty, sticky mass that looks as though it will never mix. Then all at once, presto! It looks like dark chocolate sauce. Pour hot espresso over the honey, stirring to dissolve. Serve with cream.

357.name: Absinthe #2
357.instructions: Mix together and let sit a few days. Strain through a coffee filter. To serve mix 1 part absinthe to 4 parts water, add ice, enjoy.

358.name: Creme de Menthe
358.instructions: Bring sugar and water to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Cool. Add the remaining ingredients and stir. Cover and let ripen for 1 month.

359.name: Spanish chocolate
359.instructions: Stir the milk with the chocolate and the cinnamon over low heat until the chocolate dissolves. Add the eggs and beat the mixture until it becomes thick, taking care not to boil. Serve in coffee mug.

360.name: Miami Vice
360.instructions: First: Mix pina colada with 2.5 oz. of rum with ice(set aside). Second: Mix daiquiri with 2.5 oz. of rum with ice. Third: While frozen, add pina colda mix then daiquiri mix in glass (Making sure they do not get mixed together).

361.name: Orange Crush
361.instructions: Add all ingredients to tumbler-Pour as shot

362.name: Banana Strawberry Shake
362.instructions: Blend all together in a blender until smooth.

363.name: Van Vleet
363.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

364.name: Vesuvio
364.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

365.name: Dirty Nipple
365.instructions: This is a layered shot - the Bailey's must be on top

366.name: Dry Rob Roy
366.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

367.name: Blind Russian
367.instructions: Fill glass with ice. Add all liquers. Add milk. shake.

368.name: French "75"
368.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, sugar, and lemon juice. Shake well. Pour into a collins glass. Top with the Champagne. Stir well and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.

369.name: Russian Spring Punch
369.instructions: Pour the ingredients into an highball glass, top with Sparkling wine.

370.name: Moscow Mule
370.instructions: Combine vodka and ginger beer in a highball glass filled with ice. Add lime juice. Stir gently. Garnish.

371.name: Long Island Tea
371.instructions: Combine all ingredients (except cola) and pour over ice in a highball glass. Add the splash of cola for color. Decorate with a slice of lemon and serve.

372.name: Avalon
372.instructions: Fill a tall glass with ice. Layer the Finlandia Vodka, lemon and apple juices, Pisang Ambon, and top up with lemonade. Stir slightly and garnish with a spiralled cucumber skin and a red cherry. The cucumber provides zest and looks attractive. This drink, created by Timo Haimi, took first prize in the 1991 Finlandia Vodka Long Drink Competition.

373.name: A Night In Old Mandalay
373.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the light rum, añejo rum, orange juice, and lemon juice. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with the ginger ale. Garnish with the lemon twist.

374.name: Bourbon Sling
374.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the sugar, water, lemon juice, and bourbon. Shake well. Strain well. Strain into a highball glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

375.name: Amaretto Sweet & Sour
375.instructions: Fill the blender with 3/4 ice. Add sweet & sour mix to the top of the ice. Add about 1" of pineapple juice, 1/2" of melon liqeur, and 1/2 to 1/4" of amaretto. Then blend the mix until it is of margaritta consistency or thinner.

376.name: Texas Sling
376.instructions: Blend with Ice until smooth. Serve in a tulip glass, top with whip cream.

377.name: White Lady
377.instructions: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into large cocktail glass.

378.name: Royal Gin Fizz
378.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

379.name: Strawberry Margarita
379.instructions: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lemon juice and dip rim in salt. Shake schnapps, tequila, triple sec, lemon juice, and strawberries with ice, strain into the salt-rimmed glass, and serve.

380.name: Aviation
380.instructions: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.

381.name: Boxcar
381.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.

383.name: Moranguito
383.instructions: first you put rhe absinthe, then put tequila, then put the Granadine syrup.

384.name: Frozen Mint Daiquiri
384.instructions: Combine all ingredients with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and serve.

385.name: Frisco Sour
385.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except slices of lemon and lime) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with the slices of lemon and lime and serve.

386.name: Applecar
386.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

387.name: Casa Blanca
387.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

389.name: Mudslinger
389.instructions: Add all contents to a large jug or punch bowl. Stir well!

390.name: Amaretto Liqueur
390.instructions: Combine sugar and 3/4 cup water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer until all sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and cool. In an aging container, combine apricot halves, almond extract, grain alcohol with 1/2 cup water, and brandy. Stir in cooled sugar syrup mixture. Cap and let age for 2 days. Remove apricot halves. (Save apricot halves, can be used for cooking). Add food coloring and glycerine. Stir, recap and continue aging for 1 to 2 months. Re-bottle as desired. Liqueur is ready to serve but will continue to improve with additional aging.

391.name: Shot-gun
391.instructions: Pour one part Jack Daneils and one part Jim Beam into shot glass then float Wild Turkey on top.

392.name: Diesel
392.instructions: Pour the lager first then add the blackcurrant cordial. Top up with the cider. The colour sholud be very dark approaching the colour of Guiness.

394.name: Tom Collins
394.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass alomst filled with ice cubes. Add the club soda. Stir and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.

395.name: Empellón Cocina's Fat-Washed Mezcal
395.instructions:
To ensure that your pork fat is just as delicious as theirs, here’s their adobo marinade and what to do with it (you’ll also need a rack of ribs):

4 ancho chiles, 8 guajillo chiles and 4 chipotle chiles, plus 4 cloves roasted garlic, half a cup of cider vinegar, a quarter teaspoon of Mexican oregano, 1 teaspoon of ground black pepper, a whole clove, a quarter teaspoon of ground cinnamon and a half teaspoon of ground cumin.

Toast the dried chiles and soak in water for at least an hour until they are rehydrated. Drain and discard the soaking liquid. Combine the soaked chiles with the remaining ingredients and purée until smooth.

Cold smoke a rack of baby back pork ribs by taking a large hotel pan with woodchips on one side and charcoal on the other. Place another, smaller, pan with pork ribs, above the charcoal/woodchip pan. Ignite the charcoal, being careful to not ignite the woodchips. Cover both pans with foil and allow to smoke for 10-15 minutes, until desired level of smoke is achieved, then coat with adobo marinade and wrap in tin foil prior to placing ribs in a 300 degree oven for 7 hours. When the ribs have cooled, strain off the fat and use for the infusion.

If you’re having a hard time coming up to the same kind of volume of fat, make up the balance with pork lard from a butcher. To get the same depth of flavor without the ribs, heat up the fat in a pot with a few spoons of the marinade.

Once you’ve got your tub of seasoned pork fat in cooled liquid form, pour equal amounts of Ilegal Joven mezcal and fat into a sealable container. Seal the container and give it a really good shake, then put it in the freezer overnight. When the whole thing is separated and congealed, pour it through a fine mesh chinoise. If you don’t have a chinoise, try a fine mesh strainer, or if you don’t have one of those, try spooning off most of the fat. There will be some beads of orange fat left in the strained mezcal: run that through a few layers of cheesecloth (or coffee filters in a pinch) to get rid of the last of it.

The mezcal is now ready for drinking, straight-up or in a cocktail. 

Habanero tincture

Slice habaneros and add 2 ounces Ilegal Joven mezcal.
Allow to sit overnight or until desired level of heat is achieved.
Cocktail

Combine mezcal and chocolate liqueur in a mixing glass with ice and stir for 45 seconds.
Strain into chilled coupe.
Carefully "sink" the coffee liqueur down the inside of the coupe over a spoon.
Garnish with 5 drops habanero tincture.

396.name: Quentin
396.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, Kahlua, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the nutmeg.

397.name: Sherry Flip
397.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

398.name: Brandy Cobbler
398.instructions: In an old-fashioned glass, dissolve the sugar in the club soda. Add crushed ice until the glass is almost full. Add the brandy. Stir well. Garnish with the cherry and the orange and lemon slices.

399.name: Martinez 2
399.instructions:
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.

Stir until chilled, and strain into a chilled coupe glass.

400.name: Cuba Libra
400.instructions: Fill tall glass with ice cubes. Add rum. Rub cut edge of lime on rim of glass then squeeze juice into glass. Fill with Coca-Cola. Garnish with lime slice. Enjoy!

401.name: Atomic Lokade
401.instructions: In a shaker, place lemonade, vodka, blue Curacao, and triple sec together. Shake with ice and strain into glass. Add sugar to taste

402.name: Boston Sour
402.instructions: Shake juice of lemon, powdered sugar, blended whiskey, and egg white with cracked ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

403.name: Sangria - The World's Best
403.instructions: Mix wine, sugar and fruit, and let sit in the fridge for 18-24 hours. The mixture will have a somewhat syrupy consistency. Before serving stir in brandy and cut the mixture with soda water until it have a thinner, more wine like consistency. Serve from a pitcher in wine glasses.

404.name: Americano
404.instructions: Pour the Campari and vermouth over ice into glass, add a splash of soda water and garnish with half orange slice.

405.name: Orange Scented Hot Chocolate
405.instructions: Combine all ingredients in heavy medium saucepan. Stir over low heat until chocolate melts. Increase heat and bring just to a boil, stirring often. Remove from heat and whisk untily frothy. Return to heat and bring to boil again. Remove from heat, whisk until frothy. Repeat heating and whisking once again. Discard orange peel. (Can be prepared 2 hours ahead. Let stand at room temperature. Before serving, bring just to boil, remove from heat and whisk until frothy.) Pour hot chocolate into coffee mugs. Makes 2 servings.

406.name: Castillian Hot Chocolate
406.instructions: Shift the cocoa and sugar together into a medium-sized saucepan. Dissolve the cornstarch in the water, and stir into the cocoa and sugar until it is a smooth paste. Begin heating the mixture, stirring it with a whisk, and gradually pour in the milk. Continue stirring with the whisk as you bring the liquid to a simmer. Allow the chocolate to simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring often, until it is thick, glossy and completely smooth. Serve steaming hot in coffee mug. Serves six.

407.name: Vesper
407.instructions: Shake over ice until well chilled, then strain into a deep goblet and garnish with a thin slice of lemon peel.

408.name: Danbooka
408.instructions: pour it in and mix it.

409.name: Havana Cocktail
409.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

410.name: Victor
410.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

411.name: Afternoon
411.instructions: Build into a suiting glass, with no ice. Cream on top if wanted. Served directly.

412.name: Popped cherry
412.instructions: Served over ice in a tall glass with a popped cherry (can add more popped cherries if in the mood)!

413.name: Limeade
413.instructions: In a large glass, put the lime juice and sugar, and stir well. Add cold seltzer water to fill. Put the lime peels in the glass. Drink. Repeat until limes or soda run out.

414.name: A Day at the Beach
414.instructions: Shake Rum, Amaretto, and Orange Juice in a shaker filled with ice. Strain over ice into a highball glass. Add Grenadine and garnish with a Pineapple Wedge and a Strawberry.

415.name: Snake Bite (UK)
415.instructions: Pour ingredients into a pint glass. Drink. Fall over.

416.name: Jamaica Kiss
416.instructions: Fill a tumbler with ice cubes. Add a shot of Tia Maria and a shot of Jamaican light rum. Fill the tumbler with milk. Blend until smooth and serve immediately.

417.name: Lemon Drop
417.instructions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass rimmed with sugar.

418.name: John Collins
418.instructions: Pour all ingredients directly into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Garnish. Add a dash of Angostura bitters.

419.name: Lassi - Mango
419.instructions: Put it all in a blender and pour over crushed ice. You can also use other fruits like strawberries and bananas.

420.name: Amaretto Sunrise
420.instructions: Mix together the amaretto and orange juice. Pour into glass and then add the grenadine untill you see the sunrise.

421.name: Artillery Punch
421.instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a large punch bowl with a block of ice. If found too dry, sugar syrup may be added. Decorate with twists of lemon peel.

422.name: Dry Martini
422.instructions: Straight: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain in chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.

423.name: Gin Daisy
423.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the wine, lemon juice, sugar, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.

424.name: Mother's Milk
424.instructions: Shake over ice, strain. Serves two.

425.name: Bacardi Cocktail
425.instructions: Shake together with ice. Strain into glass and serve.

426.name: Godchild
426.instructions: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a champagne flute, and serve.

427.name: Fruit Flip-Flop
427.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

428.name: Ruby Tuesday
428.instructions: Pour gin and cranberry into a highball filled with ice cubes. Add grenadine and stir.

429.name: Apricot Lady
429.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, apricot brandy, triple sec, lemon juice, and egg white. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Garnish with the orange slice.

430.name: California Root Beer
430.instructions: Put Kahlua and Galliano in highball glass fill with soda

431.name: Karsk
431.instructions: Put a copper coin in a coffe-cup and fill up with coffee until you no longer see the coin, then add alcohol until you see the coin. Norwegian speciality.

432.name: Highland Fling Cocktail
432.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except olive) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the olive and serve.

433.name: After Dinner Cocktail
433.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except lime wedge) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the wedge of lime and serve.

434.name: Caribbean Orange Liqueur
434.instructions: Pare very thinly the bright-colored rind from the oranges (no white). Blot the peel on paper towels to remove any excess oil. Put peel in a 4 cup screw-top jar. Add 2 cups vodka. Close jar. Store in a cool, dark place for 2 days or until the vodka has absorbed the flavor. Remove peel and add remaining vodka. Close jar and add remaining cup of vodka. Close the jar and store in a cool dark place at least 1 month to age.

435.name: Artillery
435.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

436.name: Gin And Tonic
436.instructions: Pour the gin and the tonic water into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lime wedge.

437.name: Absolut Evergreen
437.instructions: Mix, pour over ice and top up with Bitter Lemon.

438.name: Margarita
438.instructions: Rub the rim of the glass with the lime slice to make the salt stick to it. Take care to moisten only the outer rim and sprinkle the salt on it. The salt should present to the lips of the imbiber and never mix into the cocktail. Shake the other ingredients with ice, then carefully pour into the glass.

439.name: Monkey Wrench
439.instructions: Pour all of the ingredients into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

440.name: Chocolate Black Russian
440.instructions: Combine all ingredients in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a chilled champagne flute and serve.

441.name: Lone Tree Cooler
