441.instructions: Stir powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice, add gin and vermouth, and stir. Fill with carbonated water and stir again. Add the twist of lemon peel and the orange spiral so that the end dangles over rim of glass.

442.name: Gimlet
442.instructions:
Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.

Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass or an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.

Garnish with a lime wheel.

443.name: Nuked Hot Chocolate
443.instructions: Mix with a bit of milk (1 oz or so) in coffee mug. Nuke mug for about 30-50 seconds. Stir until the heated cocoa dissolves. Fill mug with milk. Nuke for 1-2 minutes, depending on wattage and preferences as to burnt mouth parts.

444.name: Sweet Tooth
444.instructions: Put 2 shots Godiva Liquour into a glass, add as much or as little milk as you would like.

445.name: A Piece of Ass
445.instructions: Put ice in glass. Pour in shots. Fill with Sour Mix.

446.name: Monkey Gland
446.instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

447.name: Kir Royale
447.instructions: Pour Creme de cassis in glass, gently pour champagne on top

448.name: Swedish Coffee
448.instructions: Pour the coffee in an ordinary coffee cup. Add the aquavit. Add sugar by taste. Stir and have a nice evening (morning)

449.name: Arctic Fish
449.instructions: Fill glass with ice and fish, add vodka, grape soda and orange juice. DO NOT STIR!!!!! Serve well chilled.

450.name: Pink Penocha
450.instructions: mix all ingredients into bowl keep iced stir frequently

451.name: A. J.
451.instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

452.name: Martini
452.instructions: Straight: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain in chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.

453.name: Kill the cold Smoothie
453.instructions: Juice ginger and lemon and add it to hot water. You may add cardomom.

455.name: Classic Old-Fashioned
455.instructions: In an old-fashioned glass, muddle the bitters and water into the sugar cube, using the back of a teaspoon. Almost fill the glass with ice cubes and add the bourbon. Garnish with the orange slice and the cherry. Serve with a swizzle stick.

456.name: Belgian Blue
456.instructions: Just pour all ingredients in the glass and stir...

457.name: Irish Curdling Cow
457.instructions: Pour Irish Cream, Vodka, and Bourbon in a glass. Add some ice and mix in the orange juice.

458.name: Coke and Drops
458.instructions: Take a glass, pour the Coke in the glass, then you take 7 drops of lemon juice. Granish with a lemon slice on the rim of the glass.

459.name: Caribbean Boilermaker
459.instructions: Pour the Corona into an 18oz beer glass pour the rum into the beer.

460.name: Rum Sour
460.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.

461.name: Oreo Mudslide
461.instructions: Blend Vodka, Kahlua, Bailey's, ice-cream and the Oreo well in a blender. Pour into a large frosted glass. Garnish with whipped cream and a cherry.

462.name: Whitecap Margarita
462.instructions: Place all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. This makes one drink.

463.name: Aztec Punch
463.instructions: Mix all ingredients in a pitcher. Mix thoroughly and pour into whatever is available, the bigger the better! This drink packs a big punch, so don't over do it.

464.name: Ace
464.instructions: Shake all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker and ice then strain in a cold glass.

465.name: Kiwi Lemon
465.instructions: Mix in highball glass. Stirr. Garnish with slice of kiwi.

466.name: Zinger
466.instructions: Get a shot glass and pour in three shots of the schnapps. Do the same with the Surge Cola. Then down it like Scheetz would.

467.name: Brain Fart
467.instructions: Mix all ingredients together. Slowly and gently. Works best if ice is added to punch bowl and soda's are very cold.

468.name: Adam & Eve
468.instructions: Shake together all the ingredients and strain into a cold glass.

469.name: Owen's Grandmother's Revenge
469.instructions: Add ingredients and mix in blender.

470.name: Egg-Nog - Classic Cooked
470.instructions: In large saucepan, beat together eggs, sugar and salt, if desired. Stir in 2 cups of the milk. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick enough to coat a metal spoon and reaches 160 degrees F. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 2 cups milk and vanilla. Cover and regfigerate until thoroughly chilled, several hours or overnight. Just before serving, pour into bowl or pitcher. Garnish or add stir-ins, if desired. Choose 1 or several of: Chocolate curls, cinnamon sticks, extracts of flavorings, flavored brandy or liqueur, fruit juice or nectar, ground nutmeg, maraschino cherries, orange slices, peppermint sticks or candy canes, plain brandy, run or whiskey, sherbet or ice-cream, whipping cream, whipped. Serve immediately.

471.name: Balmoral
471.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

472.name: Black & Tan
472.instructions: Fill pint glass half full with Bass. Next pour Guiness over a spoon slowly until glass is full. If done correctly the Guiness will stay on top and the Bass on bottom hence the name Black & Tan.

473.name: Queen Elizabeth
473.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

474.name: Thriller
474.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

475.name: Alice Cocktail
475.instructions: Shake well, strain into a large cocktail glass.

476.name: Sunny Holiday Punch
476.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl.

477.name: Addington
477.instructions: Mix both the vermouth's in a shaker and strain into a cold glass. Top up with a squirt of Soda Water.

478.name: Buccaneer
478.instructions: Pour the corona into an 18oz beer glass pour the bacardi limon into the beer stir very gently

479.name: Frappé
479.instructions: Mix together. Blend at highest blender speed for about 1 minute. Pour into a glass and drink with a straw. Notes: This works best if everything is cold (if you make fresh coffee, mix it with the milk and let it sit in the fridge for 1/2 hour. If it is not frothy, add more milk, or even just some more milk powder. The froth gradually turns to liquid at the bottom of the glass, so you will find that you can sit and drink this for about 1/2 hour, with more iced coffee continually appearing at the bottom. Very refreshing.

480.name: Archbishop
480.instructions: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well.

481.name: Avalanche
481.instructions: Mix in highball glass over ice, shake well.

482.name: Tequila Sour
482.instructions: Shake tequila, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the half-slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

483.name: Vodka Fizz
483.instructions: Blend all ingredients, save nutmeg. Pour into large white wine glass and sprinkle nutmeg on top.

484.name: Army special
484.instructions: Pour Vodka, Gin and lime cordial into glass, and top up with crushed ice. Wait for ice to melt slightly and sip without a straw.

485.name: Zimadori Zinger
485.instructions: Pour Zima in a collins glass over ice and then pour the shot of Midori. Don't stir. Garnish with a cherry.

486.name: Dark and Stormy
486.instructions: In a highball glass filled with ice add 6cl dark rum and top with ginger beer. Garnish with lime wedge.

487.name: Strawberry Shivers
487.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

488.name: Gin Fizz
488.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice cubes, except soda water. Pour into glass. Top with soda water.

489.name: Pineapple Gingerale Smoothie
489.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.

490.name: After sex
490.instructions: Pour the vodka and creme over some ice cubes in a tall glass and fill up with juice. to make it beuty full make the top of the glass with a grenadine and sugar

492.name: Bloody Maria
492.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except lemon slice) with cracked ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of lemon and serve.

493.name: Japanese Fizz
493.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

494.name: Egg Nog #4
494.instructions: In a small mixer bowl beat egg yolks till blended. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, beating at high speed till thick and lemon colored. Stir in milk, stir in rum, bourbon, vanilla, and salt. Chill thoroughly. Whip cream. Wash beaters well. In a large mixer bowl beat egg whites till soft peaks form. Gradually add remaining 1/4 cup sugar, beating to stiff peaks. Fold yolk mixture and whipped cream into egg whites. Serve immediately. Sprinkle nutmeg over each serving. Serve in a punch bowl or another big bowl. NOTE: For a nonalcoholic eggnog, prepare Eggnog as above, except omit the bourbon and rum and increase the milk to 3 cups.

495.name: Salty Dog
495.instructions: Pour all ingredients over ice cubes in a highball glass. Stir well and serve. (Vodka may be substituted for gin, if preferred.)

496.name: Rum Toddy
496.instructions: Dissolve powdered sugar in water in an old-fashioned glass. Add rum and one ice cube and stir. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

497.name: Scottish Highland Liqueur
497.instructions: Combine all ingreds in aging container. Cover tightly and shake gently several times during the first 24 hrs. After 24 hrs, remove the lemon zest. Cover again and let stand in a cool, dark place for 2 weeks, shaking gently every other day. Strain through a wire sieve to remove the angelica root and fennel. Return to aging container, cover and let stand undisturbed in a cool dark place for 6 months. Siphon or pour clear liqueur into a sterile bottle. The cloudy dregs may be saved for cooking.

498.name: After Five
498.instructions: 1. Pour Kahlua into shot glass to about 1/2 full. 2. Using a spoon(inverted), slowly pour in the Peppermint Schnapps until glass is about 3/4 full. Done correctly, the Schnapps will flow under the Kahlua for a clear layer. 3. Again using a spoon, but this time right side up, slowly top off the glass with a layer of Bailey's. Be careful to place the spoon right at the top of the Kahlua layer and to raise it as the glass fills up. Done correctly, this will provide a layer of Bailey's floating over the Kahlua. 4. Toss it down all at once for something like a Peppermint Pattie, WITH A BANG!!! NOTE: Best if all ingredients are chilled

499.name: Gin Squirt
499.instructions: Stir gin, grenadine, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Decorate with the pineapple chunks and the strawberries and serve.

500.name: Caipirinha
500.instructions: Place lime and sugar into old fashioned glass and muddle (mash the two ingredients together using a muddler or a wooden spoon). Fill the glass with ice and add the Cachaça.

501.name: Absolutely Fabulous
501.instructions: Mix the Vodka and Cranberry juice together in a shaker and strain into a glass. Top up with Champagne.

502.name: Boozy Snickers Milkshake
502.instructions: Place the snickers bars in a plastic bag and roll over them with a rolling pin until crushed. Add crushed snickers pieces, ice cream, milk, caramel sauce, chocolate sauce, and chocolate liquor to a blender. Blend until shake is thick and frothy. Pour into glasses and top with chocolate liquor and whip cream.

503.name: Adonis Cocktail
503.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.

504.name: Almond Chocolate Coffee
504.instructions: Pour in order into coffee cup. Top with whipped creme and chocolate shcvings.

505.name: Midnight Mint
505.instructions: If available, rim cocktail (Martini) glass with sugar syrup then dip into chocolate flakes or powder. Add ingredients into shaker with ice. Shake well then strain into cocktail glass.

506.name: Absolut Summertime
506.instructions: Add all ingredients except lemon to shaker filled with ice. Cover and shake vigorously. Strain contents into ice filled collins glass. Garnish with lemon.

507.name: Gin Smash
507.instructions: Muddle sugar with carbonated water and mint sprigs in an old-fashioned glass. Add gin and 1 ice cube. Stir, add the orange slice and the cherry, and serve.

508.name: A midsummernight dream
508.instructions: Mix the strawberrys in a blender Pour it together with the vodka,kirch and strawberry liquer over ice in a shaker. Shake well and pour in a highballglass. Fill up with the Russchian water

510.name: Duchamp's Punch
510.instructions:
Shake all ingredients.
Double strain in a chilled double old fashioned glass with abig ice cube.
Garnish with a couple of lavender sprigs

511.name: Surf City Lifesaver
511.instructions: Lots of ice and soda top up in tall glass with cherry and a grin.

512.name: Kool First Aid
512.instructions: Add Kool Aid to a double shot glass, and top with rum. Slam and shoot.

513.name: Penicillin
513.instructions: Shake blended Scotch, lemon juice, honey syrup and ginger syrup with ice. Strain over large ice in chilled rocks glass. Float smoky Scotch on top (be sure to use a smoky Scotch such as an Islay single malt). Garnish with candied ginger.

514.name: Foxy Lady
514.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

515.name: Homemade Kahlua
515.instructions: Dissolve sugar in 2 cups of boiling water and add corn syrup. Dissolve the instant coffee in the remaining water. Pour syrup and coffee in a gallon jug. Let it cool. Add vodka and vanilla when cold. For the best result, let the mixture "mature" for 4-5 weeks.

516.name: Bahama Mama
516.instructions:
Add 2 parts club soda or more or less to taste.

Mix it all together and pour over a bunch of ice. Drink with a straw.

517.name: Banana Cantaloupe Smoothie
517.instructions: Juice cantaloupe, pour juice into blender, add banana, and liquify.

518.name: Cranberry Cordial
518.instructions: Place the chopped cranberries in a 2 liter jar that has a tight-fitting lid. Add the sugar and rum. Adjust the lid securely and place the jar in a cool, dark place. Invert the jar and shake it every day for six weeks. Strain the cordial into bottles and seal with corks.

519.name: Derby
519.instructions: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice. Stir. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint in the drink.

520.name: Tennesee Mud
520.instructions: Mix Coffee, Jack Daniels and Amaretto. Add Cream on top.

521.name: Alfie Cocktail
521.instructions: Combine and shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

522.name: Rum Punch
522.instructions: Mix all ingredients in a punch bowl and serve.

523.name: Black Forest Shake
523.instructions: In a blender put ice cubes, chocolate syrup, cherry brandy, vodka, and milk. Blend very well.

524.name: Arizona Stingers
524.instructions: Place ice cubes in the hurricane glass . Add the 2 HEAPING shots of Absolute Vodka (Note: You can add as many shots of Absolute as you want!) Fill the rest of glass with the Arizona Icetea with lemon. Stir to mix using a spoon. Drink up and enjoy!!!!!!!

525.name: A True Amaretto Sour
525.instructions: Rub the rim of an old fashioned glass with lemon, and dip repeatedly into granulated sugar until it has a good "frosted" rim. Shake a jigger of Amaretto with the juice of 1/2 a lemon. Strain into glass and add ice. Garnish with a Marachino Cherry.

526.name: Stone Sour
526.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled whiskey sour glass, and serve.

528.name: Absolutely Cranberry Smash
528.instructions: Stir ingredients together. Serve over ice.

529.name: Iced Coffee Fillip
529.instructions: Mix together in a coffee mug and chill before serving.

530.name: Cherry Rum
530.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

531.name: Arctic Mouthwash
531.instructions: Blend all ingredients in a blender on high until ice is finely crushed. It should be of a slushy consistency. Pour immediately and serve.

532.name: Apple Pie with A Crust
532.instructions: Just mix the two liquids and sprinkle in the cinnamon. Serve either cold or heated.

533.name: Chocolate Drink
533.instructions: Melt the bar in a small amount of boiling water. Add milk. Cook over low heat, whipping gently (with a whisk, i would assume) until heated well. Don't let it boil! Serve in coffee mug.

534.name: Sloe Gin Cocktail
534.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

535.name: Orange Push-up
535.instructions: Combine liquors in a blender. Add a half scoop of ice and blend. Garnish with an orange and cherry flag. So good it will melt in your mouth!!!

536.name: A Furlong Too Late
536.instructions: Pour the rum and ginger beer into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lemon twist.

537.name: Jello shots
537.instructions: Boil 3 cups of water then add jello. Mix jello and water until jello is completely disolved. Add the two cups of vodka and mix together. Pour mixture into plastic shot glasses and chill until firm. Then, eat away...

538.name: Aloha Fruit punch
538.instructions: Add 1/4 cup water to ginger root. Boil 3 minutes. Strain. Add the liquid to the guava, lemon and pineapple juices. Make a syrup of sugar and remaining water. Cool. Combine with juices and pineapple. Chill throroughly.

539.name: Arizona Antifreeze
539.instructions: Pour all ingredients into shot glass and slam !!!!

540.name: A Splash of Nash
540.instructions: Drop shot glass with banana & melon liquers into a 9 oz hi- ball glass containing soda water and cranberry juice. Drink in one shot.

541.name: Chicago Fizz
541.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

542.name: Alaska Cocktail
542.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass. Drop in a twist of lemon and serve.

543.name: Between The Sheets
543.instructions: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes, shake, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

544.name: Banana Milk Shake
544.instructions: Blend very well, preferably in a household mixer. Serve in a wine glass, garnish with whipped cream and a piece of banana.

545.name: Jelly Bean
545.instructions: mix equal parts in pony glass-tastes just like a jelly bean!

546.name: Quick-sand
546.instructions: Simply add the orange juice, quite a quick pour in order to mix the sambucca with the orange juice. The juice MUST have fruit pulp!

547.name: Screaming Orgasm
547.instructions: Pour first vodka, then Bailey's, then Kahlua into a cocktail glass over crushed ice. Stir. Caution: use only high quality vodka. Cheap vodka can cause the Bailey's to curdle. Test your brand of vodka by mixing 1 Tsp each of vodka and Bailey's first.

548.name: Gagliardo
548.instructions: Shake well and serve in a cocktail glass. This is a home cocktail of American/Internet Bar del Pozzo, Pavia, Italy.

549.name: Frozen Daiquiri
549.instructions: Combine all ingredients (except for the cherry) in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for five seconds, then blend at a high speed until firm. Pour contents into a champagne flute, top with the cherry, and serve.

551.name: New York Lemonade
551.instructions: Serve in a chilled cocktail glass. Lemon and sugar the rim. Stir and Strain.

552.name: Quaker's Cocktail
552.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

553.name: Darkwood Sling
553.instructions: There are many good cherry liqueurs you can use, but I prefere Heering. Add one share of the liqueur. Then you add one share of Soda. For a sour sling use Tonic (most people prefer the drink without Tonic). Afterwards you fill the glass with Orange Juice and ice cubes.

554.name: Pina Colada
554.instructions: Mix with crushed ice in blender until smooth. Pour into chilled glass, garnish and serve.

555.name: Godfather
555.instructions: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

556.name: Kamikaze
556.instructions: Shake all ingredients together with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve.

557.name: Poppy Cocktail
557.instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

558.name: Berry Deadly
558.instructions: Add all ingredients to large bowl. Stir gently. Serve chilled.

559.name: Applejack
559.instructions: Add all ingredients into mixing glass, chill and strain into cocktail glass
